tools

Class DerbySQLStatementFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.DerbySQLStatementFactory

  • public class DerbySQLStatementFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory for creating Derby SQL Statement Strings. Currently only the data types VARCHAR and INTEGER are supported, other datatypes can be added in @see MyDerbyDataTypes but also must be controlled in @see validateInsertData

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DerbySQLStatementFactory() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.lang.String buildCreateTableCommand(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.ArrayList<tools.Pair<java.lang.String,tools.MyDerbyDataTypes>> columns)
      Builds the create table command, this will look like: CREATE TABLE TableName (Column1 DataType1, Column2 DataType2, [...])
      static java.lang.String buildInsertCommand(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.ArrayList<tools.Triple<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,tools.MyDerbyDataTypes>> insertData)
      Builds the insert command, this will look like: INSERT INTO TableName (Column1, Column2, [...])
      static java.lang.String buildUpdateCommand(java.lang.String tableName, java.util.ArrayList<tools.Triple<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,tools.MyDerbyDataTypes>> fields, tools.Triple<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,tools.MyDerbyDataTypes> identifier)
      Builds the update command, this will look like: UPDATE TableName SET Column1 = Value1, Column2 = Value2, [...]

      • buildCreateTableCommand

        public static java.lang.String buildCreateTableCommand(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                       java.util.ArrayList<tools.Pair<java.lang.String,tools.MyDerbyDataTypes>> columns)
        Builds the create table command, this will look like: CREATE TABLE TableName (Column1 DataType1, Column2 DataType2, [...])
        Parameters:
        tableName - the table name
        columns - the columns
        Returns:
        SQL create table statement as String

      • buildInsertCommand

        public static java.lang.String buildInsertCommand(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                  java.util.ArrayList<tools.Triple<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,tools.MyDerbyDataTypes>> insertData)
                                           throws tools.UnsupportedDataException
        Builds the insert command, this will look like: INSERT INTO TableName (Column1, Column2, [...]) VALUES (Value1, Value2, [...])
        Parameters:
        tableName - the table name
        insertData - the insert data
        Returns:
        SQL insert statement as String
        Throws:
        tools.UnsupportedDataException - the unsupported data exception

      • buildUpdateCommand

        public static java.lang.String buildUpdateCommand(java.lang.String tableName,
                                                  java.util.ArrayList<tools.Triple<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,tools.MyDerbyDataTypes>> fields,
                                                  tools.Triple<java.lang.String,java.lang.String,tools.MyDerbyDataTypes> identifier)
                                           throws tools.UnsupportedDataException
        Builds the update command, this will look like: UPDATE TableName SET Column1 = Value1, Column2 = Value2, [...] WHERE PrimaryKey = Value
        Parameters:
        tableName - the table name
        fields - the fields
        identifier - the identifier
        Returns:
        SQL update statement as String
        Throws:
        tools.UnsupportedDataException - the unsupported data exception
